bibl.title: A Very Peculiar Homeric Paraphrase (P.Erl. 5, inv. 3, recto).
Archiv für Papyrusforschung und verwandte Gebiete

bibl.note: P. Erl. 5 recto (= M.-P.3 1169; LDAB 1567) contains a paraphrase of part of the argument between Zeus and Hera at the end of Book I of the Iliad. It is characterized by its similarity to the 'grammatical' rather than 'rhetorical' type of paraphrase. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: José-Antonio Fernández Delgado, A Very Peculiar Homeric Paraphrase (P.Erl. 5, inv. 3, recto).

P. Erl. 5 recto (= M.-P.3 1169; LDAB 1567) contains a paraphrase of part of the argument between Zeus and Hera at the end of Book I of the Iliad. It is characterized by its similarity to the 'grammatical' rather than 'rhetorical' type of paraphrase. - Avec résumé en anglais.
